meanings.sent1: He tends to overbrake when approaching a stop sign.
meanings.sent2: She was overbraking on the icy road, causing the car to skid.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overbraked as it tried to stop before reaching the acorn.
meanings.sent4: The chef overbraked the mixer, causing the batter to splatter everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The child overbraking on the swing made her go higher than ever before.

meanings.definition: The act of applying brakes too aggressively.
meanings.sent1: Overbraking can lead to increased wear on the brake pads.
meanings.sent2: The instructor warned against the dangers of overbraking on steep slopes.
meanings.sent3: The overbraking of the shopping cart startled the shoppers nearby.
meanings.sent4: The overbraking of the train made the passengers lurch forward in their seats.
meanings.sent5: The sound of overbraking echoed through the quiet neighborhood.
